mapper.insert: insert into sys_role (id_, role_name, dept_id, role_type, enable_, remark_, create_by, create_time, update_by, update_time) values (#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{deptId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{roleType,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{enable,jdbcType=BIT}, #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createBy,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updateBy,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP})
mapper.update: update sys_role set role_name = #{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, dept_id = #{deptId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, role_type = #{roleType,jdbcType=INTEGER}, enable_ = #{enable,jdbcType=BIT}, remark_ = #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_by = #{createBy,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_by = #{updateBy,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id_ = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select id_, role_name, dept_id, role_type, enable_, remark_, create_by, create_time, update_by, update_time from sys_role where id_ = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
select id_, role_name, dept_id, role_type, enable_, remark_, create_by, create_time, update_by, update_time from sys_role
